content:
I have a 2D array arr : Array (Array Î±) defined by let mut arr := .. and I want to set arr[i][j] = x. Currently I'm using arr := arr.set! i (arr[i]!.set! j x), but I'm not sure it doesn't copy arr[i], and it's also quite long to type.
Is there a better way to do this?
I wonder if we should just add set\_2.

Eric Wieser said:

Can you use modify instead?

I didn't know of that function, thanks. Should I use it like arr.modify i (fun a => a.set j x)?
Yes, that was what I was suggesting
